@beiwei30 
Hi , beiwei, please review it.

@lovepoem 
> 1. Can this change be moved to https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite?
> thanks for your advice,I think it would be better to move this piece of code 
 to https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite. Do I need to open a new pr in hessian-lite and close this one?

>typeNotFoundDeserializer is only used in this class.

> thanks for your advice,I think it would be better to move this piece of
code
to https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite. Do I need to open a new pr in
hessian-lite and close this one?

If so , please work on the repository :
https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite  and test is

hopelove404 <notifications@github.com> 于2019年1月28日周一 下午6:41写道：

> @lovepoem <https://github.com/lovepoem>
>
>
>    1. Can this change be moved to https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite?
>    thanks for your advice,I think it would be better to move this piece

>    to https://github.com/dubbo/hessian-lite. Do I need to open a new pr

@CrazyHZM i think for now, just for branch. after 2.7.0 release, it can apply to master
+1 with @tswstarplanet ,can your tell us which test case has failed?

There are many logs printed to console by `DubboAppender`.
`DubboAppender` is extended from `ConsoleAppender`, it will print to console then cache the log in memory, and some unit test case are depending on it.

I am trying to make `DubboAppender` extend from `FileAppender`, it will print to the local file instead of the console without breaking any unit test logic.
I did some test in my forked repo, here is the patch https://github.com/biyuhao/incubator-dubbo/commit/b4b7812827dc808c82831751ab89f1232ec215c0

And the corresponding Travis log
https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/485302374/log.txt
https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/485302373/log.txt

As you can see, after this tweak, the Travis log dropped to about 1.51MB.
I'm not sure if there is any better idea. If this solution is fine I'll send a PR.
Anything we can do in this issue? Shall we close this issue now?
@beiwei30 This pr looks good to me. You've requested change before, would you please confirm it?
I think it's OK to close it now.
@biyuhao Would you like to help to fix it?

Yes, it's hard to reproduce in my environment.
 I'm willing to give it a try.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3047563/51855051-43f14600-2367-11e9-8c85-650a3049b059.png)
就是超时了，可能是你们的系统不支持那么高的并发
客户端调用服务端的结果是用future包装起来房子一个集合里。这个线程会在客户端一直扫描还没有返回结果的future，发现超时的就报这个错了

@ralf0131 I send a mail to discuss with this, but i didn't get any reply.
can we disscus with github?
In this way, if there is some error, are we able to check the file for detailed exception?
let's merge it, I will follow up with the error message.
Generally looks good to me. @carryxyh Could you review and accept it?
Hi, is this issue solved? @yuemingming
yeah. I will take a look.
@hopelove404, I agree with @lovepoem's suggestion. This blacklist logic should put into **dubbo/hessian-lite** instead of dubbo project.
Could you please upload a demo project on github?
let's merge it, and follow up to enhance.

#### for Travis environment
We can output all the unit test log to one local file maybe `PROJECT_ROOT/dubbo.log`.
If there is some error, use Travis `after_failure` to print last information of `dubbo.log`.
```
after_failure:
  - if [ -f dubbo.log ]; then echo "------TAIL of dubbo.log------"; tail -n 1000 dubbo.log; echo "------END of dubbo.log------"; fi
```

> What's the difference between ConfigUtils with ConfigurationUtils？

ConfigUtils serves only for the reading of local `.properties` file, such as `dubbo.properties` in your classpath. It's legacy from 2.6.x.

ConfigurationUtils is newly introduced in 2.7.0, it reads properties from CompositeConfiguration 
 while ConfigUtils is included only as one property source of  sources, for example

You should use `ConfigutionUtils` instead of `ConfigUtils` start from 2.7.0. I admit that it's to some extent confusing, we'll see how to better distinguish these two classes next.

I think it's quite similar to using other serialization mechanisms, say hessian. The only thing you need to do is to tell the service the serialization type you choose to use, like this:
```xml
<dubbo:service serialization="protostuff" interface="com.alibaba.dubbo.demo.DemoService" ref="demoService"/>
```

Thanks to protostuff, simple POJO java object can be serialized & deserialized directly, no extra .poto files are needed.
